CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION uniquePaths(m n)  
        SET matrix AS a list containing m elements, each being a list of length n filled with 1  
        SET rowIndex TO 1  
        WHILE rowIndex < m DO  
            SET columnIndex TO 1  
            WHILE columnIndex < n DO  
                SET currentRow TO matrix[rowIndex]  
                SET currentRow[columnIndex] TO matrix[rowIndex - 1][columnIndex] + currentRow[columnIndex - 1]  
                SET columnIndex TO columnIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET rowIndex TO rowIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN matrix[m - 1][n - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION uniquePaths(m n)  
        SET dp TO a two dimensional list with m rows and n columns where each element is set to one  
        FOR i FROM two TO m  
            FOR j FROM two TO n  
                SET element at position i of dp TO the list at position i of dp  
                SET element at position j of element at position i of dp TO the sum of the element at position i MINUS one of dp at position j AND the element at position i of dp at position j MINUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position m MINUS one of dp at position n MINUS one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET is_palindrome TO a two dimensional collection of size n by n filled with FALSE  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET element at position i at position i of is_palindrome TO TRUE  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR length FROM two TO n  
            FOR start FROM zero TO n MINUS length  
                SET end TO start PLUS length MINUS one  
                IF length EQUALS two  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s AND the element at position start PLUS one at position end MINUS one of is_palindrome  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        SET min_cuts TO a collection of size n filled with zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF element at position zero at position i of is_palindrome  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO zero  
            ELSE  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO positive infinity  
                FOR j FROM one TO i  
                    IF element at position j at position i of is_palindrome AND element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one LESS THAN element at position i of min_cuts  
                        SET element at position i of min_cuts TO element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n MINUS one of min_cuts  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)  
        SET word_sets TO empty list  
        FOR each word IN words  
            APPEND the set of characters of word TO word_sets  
        END FOR  
        
        SET max_product TO zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF words MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM i PLUS one TO the LENGTH OF words MINUS one  
                IF the intersection of element at position i of word_sets AND element at position j of word_sets EQUALS empty set  
                    SET product TO the LENGTH OF element at position i of words MULTIPLIED BY the LENGTH OF element at position j of words  
                    IF product GREATER THAN max_product  
                        SET max_product TO product  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN max_product  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION bulbSwitch(n)  
        DECLARE result AS INTEGER  
        SET result TO 0  
        WHILE (result + 1) * (result + 1) <= n DO  
            INCREMENT result BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION bulbSwitch(n)  
        RETURN the integer part of the square root of n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET cache AS a list containing (amount + 1) copies of (amount + 1)  
        ASSIGN 0 TO cache[0]  

        SET counter TO 1  
        WHILE counter ≤ amount  
            SET currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            FOR each denomination IN coins  
                SET remainder TO counter - denomination  
                IF remainder ≥ 0 THEN  
                    SET candidate TO cache[remainder] + 1  
                    IF candidate < currentMin THEN  
                        ASSIGN candidate TO currentMin  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            ASSIGN currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF cache[amount] ≠ (amount + 1) THEN  
            RETURN cache[amount]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET dp TO a list of amount PLUS one elements each set TO amount PLUS one  
        SET element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        FOR each a FROM one TO amount  
            FOR each coin IN coins  
                IF a MINUS coin IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero  
                    SET dp at position a TO the minimum BETWEEN dp at position a AND dp at position a MINUS coin PLUS one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        IF dp at position amount IS NOT EQUAL TO amount PLUS one  
            RETURN dp at position amount  
        ELSE  
            RETURN minus one  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countNumbersWithUniqueDigits(n)  
        SWITCH n  
            CASE 0:  
                RETURN 1  
            CASE 1:  
                RETURN 10  
        END SWITCH  
  
        SET total_sum AS 10  
        SET digits_left AS 9  
        SET product AS 9  
        SET index AS 2  
        WHILE index <= n DO  
            SET product AS product * digits_left  
            SET total_sum AS total_sum + product  
            SET digits_left AS digits_left - 1  
            SET index AS index + 1  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN total_sum  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countNumbersWithUniqueDigits(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero THEN  
            RETURN one  
        END IF  
        IF n EQUALS one THEN  
            RETURN ten  
        END IF  
        SET count TO ten  
        SET available_digits TO nine  
        SET choices TO nine  
        FOR i FROM two TO n INCLUSIVE  
            SET choices TO choices MULTIPLIED BY available_digits  
            SET count TO count PLUS choices  
            SET available_digits TO available_digits MINUS one  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION wordsTyping(sentence, rows, cols)  
        ASSIGN concatenated_string TO EMPTY STRING  
        INITIALIZE index_counter TO 0  
        
        WHILE index_counter LESS THAN LENGTH OF sentence  
            CONCATENATE concatenated_string WITH sentence[index_counter]  
            CONCATENATE concatenated_string WITH " "  
            INCREMENT index_counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN length_total TO LENGTH OF concatenated_string  
        SET pointer TO 0  
        ASSIGN row_iter TO 1  
        
        WHILE row_iter LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO rows  
            ADD cols TO pointer  
            IF concatenated_string[pointer MOD length_total] IS " " THEN  
                INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
            ELSE  
                WHILE (pointer GREATER THAN 0) AND (concatenated_string[(pointer - 1) MOD length_total] IS NOT " ")  
                    DECREASE pointer BY 1  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT row_iter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN INTEGER_DIVISION OF pointer BY length_total  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION wordsTyping(sentence, rows, cols)  
        SET s TO the concatenation of all elements of sentence with a single space between each followed by a single space character  
        SET total_length TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET position TO zero  
        
        FOR each iteration IN the range from one TO rows  
            INCREMENT position BY cols  
            
            IF the element at position MODULO total_length of s EQUALS a space character  
                INCREMENT position BY one  
            ELSE  
                WHILE position GREATER THAN zero AND the element at position MINUS one MODULO total_length of s NOT EQUALS a space character  
                    DECREMENT position BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN position DIVIDED BY total_length  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)
        SET length_password AS LENGTH OF password
        SET lower_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS lowercase letter
        SET upper_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS uppercase letter
        SET digit_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS digit

        SET missing_char_types AS 3 MINUS (lower_found PLUS upper_found PLUS digit_found)

        SET replacements_needed TO 0
        SET count_mod0 TO 0
        SET count_mod1 TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 2

        WHILE index_counter < length_password
            IF (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1]) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 2])
                SET streak_length TO 2
                WHILE (index_counter < length_password) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1])
                    SET streak_length TO (streak_length PLUS 1)
                    SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
                END WHILE

                SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed PLUS (streak_length DIV 3)

                IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 0
                    SET count_mod0 TO count_mod0 PLUS 1
                ELSE IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 1
                    SET count_mod1 TO count_mod1 PLUS 1
                END IF
            ELSE
                SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
            END IF
        END WHILE

        IF length_password < 6
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND (6 MINUS length_password)
        ELSE IF length_password <= 20
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        ELSE
            SET excess_length TO length_password MINUS 20

            SET min_del0 AS MINIMUM OF excess_length AND count_mod0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS min_del0

            SET remaining_after_del0 TO MAXIMUM OF (excess_length MINUS min_del0) AND 0
            SET min_del1 AS MINIMUM OF remaining_after_del0 AND (count_mod1 TIMES 2)
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (min_del1 DIV 2)

            SET remaining_after_del1 TO MAXIMUM OF (remaining_after_del0 MINUS min_del1) AND 0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (remaining_after_del1 DIV 3)

            RETURN excess_length PLUS MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF password  
        
        SET has_lower TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is a lowercase letter  
        SET has_upper TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is an uppercase letter  
        SET has_digit TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is a digit  
        
        SET missing_types TO three MINUS the SUM OF has_lower PLUS has_upper PLUS has_digit  
        
        SET replace TO zero  
        SET one TO zero  
        SET two TO zero  
        SET i TO two  
        WHILE i LESS THAN n  
            IF the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS one of password AND the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS two of password  
                SET length TO two  
                WHILE i LESS THAN n AND the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS one of password  
                    INCREMENT length BY one  
                    INCREMENT i BY one  
                END WHILE  
                INCREMENT replace BY the INTEGER DIVISION of length BY three  
                IF the MODULO of length BY three EQUALS zero  
                    INCREMENT one BY one  
                ELSE IF the MODULO of length BY three EQUALS one  
                    INCREMENT two BY one  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT i BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        
        IF n LESS THAN six  
            RETURN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND six MINUS n  
        ELSE IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO twenty  
            RETURN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND replace  
        ELSE  
            SET delete TO n MINUS twenty  
            
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the SMALLER VALUE BETWEEN delete AND one  
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the INTEGER DIVISION BY two OF the SMALLER VALUE BETWEEN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN delete MINUS one AND zero AND two MULTIPLIED BY two  
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the INTEGER DIVISION BY three OF the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN delete MINUS one MINUS two MULTIPLIED BY two AND zero  
            
            RETURN delete PLUS the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND replace  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s  
        DECLARE freqMap AS mapping from character to integer  
        FOR index FROM 0 TO LENGTH(s) - 1 DO  
            SET currentChar TO s[index]  
            IF freqMap DOES NOT CONTAIN currentChar THEN  
                SET freqMap[currentChar] AS 1  
            ELSE  
                SET freqMap[currentChar] TO freqMap[currentChar] + 1  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        DECLARE charList AS list of characters  
        SET charList TO KEYS OF freqMap  

        DECLARE descSortedChars AS list of characters  
        SET descSortedChars TO SORT charList BY (a, b) → (freqMap[b] - freqMap[a])  

        SET outputString TO EMPTY STRING  
        DECLARE iterator AS integer ← 0  
        WHILE iterator < LENGTH(descSortedChars) DO  
            DECLARE ch AS character ← descSortedChars[iterator]  
            DECLARE count AS integer ← freqMap[ch]  
            DECLARE tempString AS string ← EMPTY STRING  
            FOR repeatIndex FROM 1 TO count DO  
                SET tempString ← tempString + ch  
            END FOR  
            SET outputString ← outputString + tempString  
            SET iterator ← iterator + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN outputString  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s  
        SET frequency TO the character frequency mapping of s  
        SET sorted_characters TO the list of characters in frequency arranged in descending order according to their frequency values  
        SET result TO an empty string  
        FOR each character IN sorted_characters  
            APPEND the character repeated the number of times equal to the frequency of the character TO result  
        END FOR  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        DECLARE bracketStrings AS empty list  
        DECLARE count AS 1  
        WHILE count LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            INSERT TO bracketStrings THE STRING OF count  
            INCREMENT count BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        WHILE n NOT EQUAL TO 1  
            DECLARE index AS 0  
            DECLARE limit AS n DIV 2  
            WHILE index LESS THAN limit  
                DECLARE leftSide AS bracketStrings AT index  
                DECLARE rightSide AS bracketStrings AT (n - 1 - index)  
                ASSIGN bracketStrings AT index TO "(" + leftSide + "," + rightSide + ")"  
                INCREMENT index BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET n AS n DIV 2  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN bracketStrings AT 0  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        SET teams TO an empty list  
        FOR number FROM one TO n  
            APPEND the string representation of number TO teams  
        END FOR  
        WHILE n GREATER THAN one  
            FOR i FROM zero TO n DIVIDED BY two MINUS one  
                SET teams at position i TO the concatenation of an open parenthesis concatenated with the element at position i of teams concatenated with a comma concatenated with the element at position n MINUS one MINUS i of teams concatenated with a close parenthesis  
            END FOR  
            SET n TO n DIVIDED BY two  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN the element at position zero of teams  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION repeatedStringMatch(a string, b string) RETURNS integer  
        DECLARE minReps INTEGER  
        ASSIGN minReps TO CEILING(LENGTH(b) / LENGTH(a))  
        
        DECLARE candidate STRING  
        ASSIGN candidate TO a  
        DECLARE repeatedCandidate STRING  
        
        ASSIGN repeatedCandidate TO CONCATENATE(candidate REPEATED minReps TIMES)  
        IF CONTAINS(repeatedCandidate, b) THEN  
            RETURN minReps  
        END IF  
        
        ASSIGN repeatedCandidate TO CONCATENATE(candidate REPEATED (minReps + 1) TIMES)  
        IF CONTAINS(repeatedCandidate, b) THEN  
            RETURN (minReps + 1)  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION repeatedStringMatch(a string, b string) RETURNS integer  
        SET minimum repetitions TO the smallest integer greater than or equal to the LENGTH OF b DIVIDED BY the LENGTH OF a  
        IF string b IS a substring of string a repeated minimum repetitions times  
            RETURN minimum repetitions  
        END IF  
        IF string b IS a substring of string a repeated minimum repetitions PLUS one times  
            RETURN minimum repetitions PLUS one  
        END IF  
        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET length_s1 AS LENGTH OF s1  
        SET length_s2 AS LENGTH OF s2  
        
        DECLARE dp AS LIST OF LISTS WITH (length_s1 + 1) ROWS AND (length_s2 + 1) COLUMNS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        SET idx_col TO 1  
        WHILE idx_col <= length_s2  
            LET previous_value BE dp[0][idx_col - 1]  
            LET ascii_code BE ASCII OF s2[idx_col - 1]  
            dp[0][idx_col] ← previous_value + ascii_code  
            idx_col ← idx_col + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET idx_row TO 1  
        WHILE idx_row <= length_s1  
            LET previous_value_row BE dp[idx_row - 1][0]  
            LET ascii_code_row BE ASCII OF s1[idx_row - 1]  
            dp[idx_row][0] ← previous_value_row + ascii_code_row  
            idx_row ← idx_row + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET outer_index TO 1  
        WHILE outer_index <= length_s1  
            SET inner_index TO 1  
            WHILE inner_index <= length_s2  
                LET char_s1 BE s1[outer_index - 1]  
                LET char_s2 BE s2[inner_index - 1]  
                IF char_s1 ≠ char_s2 THEN
                    LET deletion_s1 COST ← dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index] + ASCII OF char_s1  
                    LET deletion_s2 COST ← dp[outer_index][inner_index - 1] + ASCII OF char_s2  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE MINIMUM OF deletion_s1 COST AND deletion_s2 COST  
                ELSE  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index - 1]  
                END IF  
                inner_index ← inner_index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            outer_index ← outer_index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[length_s1][length_s2]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET m TO the LENGTH OF s1  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s2  
        
        CREATE a two dimensional list dp WITH dimensions m PLUS one BY n PLUS one INITIALIZED WITH zeroes  
        
        FOR j FROM one TO n  
            SET element at position j of the first row of dp TO element at position j MINUS one of the first row of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position j MINUS one of s2  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM one TO m  
            SET element at position i of the first column of dp TO element at position i MINUS one of the first column of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position i MINUS one of s1  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM one TO m  
            FOR j FROM one TO n  
                IF character at position i MINUS one of s1 EQUALS character at position j MINUS one of s2  
                    SET element at position i , position j of dp TO element at position i MINUS one , position j MINUS one of dp  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position i , position j of dp TO the MINIMUM OF element at position i MINUS one , position j of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position i MINUS one of s1 AND element at position i , position j MINUS one of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position j MINUS one of s2  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position m , position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        INITIALIZE filteredStart AS empty list  
        INITIALIZE posCounter TO 0  
        WHILE posCounter < LENGTH(start parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN currentChar TO start parameter[posCounter]  
            IF NOT (currentChar = 'X') THEN  
                SET filteredStart TO filteredStart CONCATENATED WITH [(currentChar, posCounter)]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT posCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE filteredEnd AS empty list  
        ASSIGN idxCursor TO 0  
        WHILE idxCursor < LENGTH(end parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN ch TO end parameter[idxCursor]  
            IF ch <> 'X' THEN  
                SET filteredEnd TO filteredEnd + [(ch, idxCursor)]  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN idxCursor TO idxCursor + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF LENGTH(filteredStart) != LENGTH(filteredEnd) THEN  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO  
            ASSIGN firstTuple TO filteredStart[pairIndex]  
            ASSIGN secondTuple TO filteredEnd[pairIndex]  

            ASSIGN charA TO firstTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posA TO firstTuple[1]  
            ASSIGN charB TO secondTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posB TO secondTuple[1]  

            IF NOT (charA = charB) THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  

            IF charA = 'L' THEN  
                IF posA < posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            ELSE IF charA = 'R' THEN  
                IF posA > posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            SET pairIndex TO pairIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        SET start_filtered TO empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF start parameter MINUS one  
            SET character_at_index TO element at position index of start parameter  
            IF character_at_index NOT EQUALS the character X  
                APPEND tuple of character_at_index AND index TO start_filtered  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET end_filtered TO empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF end parameter MINUS one  
            SET character_at_index TO element at position index of end parameter  
            IF character_at_index NOT EQUALS the character X  
                APPEND tuple of character_at_index AND index TO end_filtered  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF the LENGTH OF start_filtered NOT EQUALS the LENGTH OF end_filtered  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  
        FOR each pair of tuples first_pair AND second_pair IN the PAIRWISE ITERATION OF start_filtered AND end_filtered  
            SET character_one TO the first element of first_pair  
            SET index_one TO the second element of first_pair  
            SET character_two TO the first element of second_pair  
            SET index_two TO the second element of second_pair  
            IF character_one NOT EQUALS character_two  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            IF character_one EQUALS the character L AND index_one LESS THAN index_two  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            IF character_one EQUALS the character R AND index_one GREATER THAN index_two  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean
        LOOP_WHILE (tx IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sx) AND (ty IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sy)
            IF (NOT (tx IS_DIFFERS_FROM sx)) AND (NOT (ty IS_DIFFERS_FROM sy))
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN ty
                IF ty IS_GREATER_THAN sy
                    LET dividend = tx
                    LET divisor = ty
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO tx
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = tx MINUS sx
                    LET denominator = ty
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN sx
                    LET dividend = ty
                    LET divisor = tx
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO ty
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = ty MINUS sy
                    LET denominator = tx
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            END IF
        END LOOP_WHILE
        RETURN False
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean  
        WHILE tx GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO sx AND ty GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO sy  
            IF tx EQUALS sx AND ty EQUALS sy  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
            IF tx GREATER THAN ty  
                IF ty GREATER THAN sy  
                    SET tx TO the remainder of tx DIVIDED BY ty  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN the remainder of tx MINUS sx DIVIDED BY ty EQUALS zero  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                IF tx GREATER THAN sx  
                    SET ty TO the remainder of ty DIVIDED BY tx  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN the remainder of ty MINUS sy DIVIDED BY tx EQUALS zero  
                END IF  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN False  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numTilings(n)  
        SET MOD to 1_000_000_007  
        
        SET dp AS a list initialized with zeros, size n PLUS 1  
        SET dp1 AS a list initialized with zeros, size n PLUS 1  
        
        ASSIGN 1 TO dp[0]  
        ASSIGN 1 TO dp[1]  
        IF n LESS THAN 2 THEN  
            GOTO after_initialization  
        ELSE  
            ASSIGN 2 TO dp[2]  
            ASSIGN 1 TO dp1[2]  
        END IF  
        LABEL after_initialization  
        
        SET index TO 3  
        WHILE index LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n DO  
            SET part1 TO (dp[index - 1] + dp[index - 2]) MOD MOD  
            SET part2 TO (2 * dp1[index - 1]) MOD MOD  
            ASSIGN (part1 + part2) MOD MOD TO dp[index]  
            
            SET dp1[index] TO ((dp[index - 2] + dp1[index - 1]) MOD MOD)  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numTilings(n)  
        SET MOD TO the one billion PLUS seven  
        
        SET dp TO a list of zeros with LENGTH n PLUS one  
        SET dp1 TO a list of zeros with LENGTH n PLUS one  
        
        SET element at position zero of dp TO one  
        SET element at position one of dp TO one  
        IF n GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO two THEN  
            SET element at position two of dp TO two  
            SET element at position two of dp1 TO one  
        END IF  
        
        FOR i FROM three TO n DO  
            SET element at position i of dp TO the remainder of the sum of element at position i MINUS one of dp PLUS element at position i MINUS two of dp PLUS two MULTIPLIED BY element at position i MINUS one of dp1 when divided by MOD  
            SET element at position i of dp1 TO the remainder of the sum of element at position i MINUS two of dp PLUS element at position i MINUS one of dp1 when divided by MOD  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF NOT (source NOT EQUAL target)  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE busMap AS a new empty mapping DefaultDict of list  
        SET i TO 0  
        WHILE i LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes  
            SET currentRoute TO routes[i]  
            SET j TO 0  
            WHILE j LESS THAN LENGTH OF currentRoute  
                APPEND i TO busMap[currentRoute[j]]  
                SET j TO j PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET i TO i PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE queue AS an empty double ended queue  
        INITIALIZE visitedBuses AS an empty set  
        INITIALIZE seenStops AS an empty set  

        FOR each busIndex IN busMap[source]  
            ENQUEUE (busIndex, 1) INTO queue  
            INSERT busIndex INTO visitedBuses  
        END FOR  
        INSERT source INTO seenStops  

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY  
            DEQUEUE FROM queue INTO currentBus, currentCount  

            SET k TO 0  
            WHILE k LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes[currentBus]  
                SET currStop TO routes[currentBus][k]  

                IF currStop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN currentCount  
                END IF  

                IF currStop NOT IN seenStops  
                    INSERT currStop INTO seenStops  

                    FOR each nextBus IN busMap[currStop]  
                        IF nextBus NOT IN visitedBuses  
                            INSERT nextBus INTO visitedBuses  
                            ENQUEUE (nextBus, currentCount PLUS 1) INTO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  

                SET k TO k PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF source EQUALS target  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  

        SET stop_to_buses TO an empty mapping from keys to empty lists  
        FOR each bus WITH index bus_index AND route IN routes  
            FOR each stop IN route  
                APPEND bus_index TO the list corresponding to stop IN stop_to_buses  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET bus_queue TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET visited_buses TO an empty set  
        SET visited_stops TO an empty set  

        FOR each bus IN the list of buses at the source stop FROM stop_to_buses  
            APPEND the tuple consisting of bus AND one TO bus_queue  
            ADD bus TO visited_buses  
            ADD source TO visited_stops  
        END FOR  

        WHILE bus_queue is not empty  
            REMOVE the first element FROM bus_queue AND ASSIGN the elements TO current_bus AND bus_count  

            FOR each stop IN the route at position current_bus OF routes  
                IF stop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN bus_count  
                END IF  

                IF stop NOT IN visited_stops  
                    ADD stop TO visited_stops  
                    FOR each next_bus IN the list of buses at stop FROM stop_to_buses  
                        IF next_bus NOT IN visited_buses  
                            ADD next_bus TO visited_buses  
                            APPEND the tuple consisting of next_bus AND bus_count PLUS one TO bus_queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET repeating TO empty set  
        DEFINE index AS 0  
        WHILE index LESS THAN the LENGTH OF fronts  
            SET front_val TO fronts[index]  
            SET back_val TO backs[index]  
            IF front_val EQUAL back_val THEN  
                ADD front_val TO repeating  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET combined_values TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN fronts DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        FOR EACH val IN backs DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        SET candidates TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN combined_values DO  
            IF NOT (val IN repeating) THEN  
                ADD val TO candidates  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        IF LENGTH OF candidates IS NOT EQUAL TO 0 THEN  
            SET result TO NULL  
            SET iterator TO candidates.iterator()  
            SET result TO iterator.next()  
            WHILE iterator.hasNext() DO  
                SET current_val TO iterator.next()  
                IF current_val LESS THAN result THEN  
                    SET result TO current_val  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET same TO empty set  
        FOR each pair of front_card AND back_card IN fronts AND backs simultaneously  
            IF front_card EQUALS back_card  
                ADD front_card TO same  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET all_numbers TO empty set  
        FOR each number IN fronts  
            ADD number TO all_numbers  
        END FOR  
        FOR each number IN backs  
            ADD number TO all_numbers  
        END FOR  
        SET good_numbers TO empty set  
        FOR each number IN all_numbers  
            IF number NOT IN same  
                ADD number TO good_numbers  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF the LENGTH OF good_numbers IS GREATER THAN zero  
            SET minimum_good_number TO the smallest element IN good_numbers  
            RETURN minimum_good_number  
        ELSE  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)
        SET length_arr AS LENGTH OF arr
        SET maximum_length TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 1
        LOOP
            IF NOT (index_counter < length_arr - 1) THEN
                BREAK
            END IF

            IF (arr[index_counter - 1] < arr[index_counter]) AND (arr[index_counter] > arr[index_counter + 1]) THEN
                SET left_marker AS index_counter - 1
                SET right_marker AS index_counter + 1

                WHILE (left_marker > 0) AND (arr[left_marker - 1] < arr[left_marker])
                    left_marker ← left_marker - 1
                END WHILE

                WHILE (right_marker < length_arr - 1) AND (arr[right_marker] > arr[right_marker + 1])
                    right_marker ← right_marker + 1
                END WHILE

                SET current_mountain_length AS right_marker - left_marker + 1
                IF maximum_length < current_mountain_length THEN
                    maximum_length ← current_mountain_length
                END IF

                index_counter ← right_marker
            ELSE
                index_counter ← index_counter + 1
            END IF
        END LOOP
        RETURN maximum_length
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF arr  
        SET longest TO zero  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i LESS THAN n MINUS one  
            IF element at position i MINUS one of arr LESS THAN element at position i of arr AND element at position i of arr GREATER THAN element at position i PLUS one of arr  
                SET left TO i MINUS one  
                SET right TO i PLUS one  
                WHILE left GREATER THAN zero AND element at position left MINUS one of arr LESS THAN element at position left of arr  
                    DECREMENT left BY one  
                END WHILE  
                WHILE right LESS THAN n MINUS one AND element at position right of arr GREATER THAN element at position right PLUS one of arr  
                    INCREMENT right BY one  
                END WHILE  
                IF longest LESS THAN right MINUS left PLUS one  
                    SET longest TO right MINUS left PLUS one  
                END IF  
                SET i TO right  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT i BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN longest  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION carFleet(target, position, speed)  
        SET combinedPairs AS EMPTY LIST  
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH OF position  
            APPEND (position[idx], speed[idx]) TO combinedPairs  
            INCREMENT idx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SORT combinedPairs BY FIRST ELEMENT DESCENDING  

        SET arrivalTimes AS EMPTY LIST  
        SET pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex LESS THAN LENGTH OF combinedPairs  
            LET loc BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][0]  
            LET vel BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][1]  
            LET timeVal BE (target MINUS loc) DIVIDED BY vel  
            APPEND timeVal TO arrivalTimes  
            INCREMENT pairIndex BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET fleetCount TO 0  
        SET maxObservedTime TO 0  

        SET timeIdx TO 0  
        WHILE timeIdx LESS THAN LENGTH OF arrivalTimes  
            LET currentTime BE arrivalTimes[timeIdx]  
            IF NOT (currentTime LESS OR EQUAL maxObservedTime) THEN  
                SET maxObservedTime TO currentTime  
                SET fleetCount TO fleetCount PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT timeIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN fleetCount  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION carFleet(target position speed)  
        SET paired_list TO the list of elements obtained by pairing each element at each position in position WITH the element at the corresponding position in speed  
        SORT paired_list in order from the greatest element of the first component to the smallest element of the first component  

        SET time_to_target TO an empty list  
        FOR each pair IN paired_list  
            SET p TO the first component of pair  
            SET s TO the second component of pair  
            SET time TO target MINUS p DIVIDED BY s  
            APPEND time TO time_to_target  
        END FOR  

        SET fleets TO zero  
        SET current_max_time TO zero  

        FOR each time IN time_to_target  
            IF time GREATER THAN current_max_time  
                INCREMENT fleets BY one  
                SET current_max_time TO time  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN fleets  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET vectors AS the collection of pairs [(1,0), (-1,0), (0,1), (0,-1)]  
        SET height AS LENGTH OF grid  
        SET width AS LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX zero  
        SET origin WITH NO INITIAL VALUE  
        SET total_keys AS 0  
        SET row_idx AS 0  
        WHILE row_idx < height  
            SET col_idx AS 0  
            WHILE col_idx < width  
                IF grid AT row_idx AND col_idx IS '@' THEN  
                    SET origin TO (row_idx, col_idx)  
                ELSE IF 'a' <= grid AT row_idx AND col_idx AND grid AT row_idx AND col_idx <= 'z' THEN  
                    SET total_keys TO total_keys + 1  
                END IF  
                SET col_idx TO col_idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET row_idx TO row_idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET frontier AS A new deque INITIALIZED WITH [(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0, 0)]  
        SET encountered AS A set WITH {(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0)}  
        
        WHILE NOT EMPTY frontier  
            SET curr_x, curr_y, acquired_keys, step_count TO POP LEFT frontier  
            FOR EACH vector_x, vector_y IN vectors  
                SET next_x TO curr_x + vector_x  
                SET next_y TO curr_y + vector_y  
                
                IF 0 <= next_x AND next_x < height AND 0 <= next_y AND next_y < width THEN  
                    SET cell_value TO grid AT next_x AND next_y  
                    IF cell_value = '#' THEN  
                        CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'A' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'Z' THEN  
                        SET lock_bit TO 1 << (ORD(LOWERCASE cell_value) - ORD('a'))  
                        IF (acquired_keys & lock_bit) = 0 THEN  
                            CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'a' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'z' THEN  
                        SET updated_keys TO (acquired_keys | 1 << (ORD cell_value - ORD 'a'))  
                        IF updated_keys = (1 << total_keys) - 1 THEN  
                            RETURN step_count + 1  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET updated_keys TO acquired_keys  
                    END IF  
                    
                    IF (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) NOT IN encountered THEN  
                        ADD (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) TO encountered  
                        APPEND (next_x, next_y, updated_keys, step_count + 1) TO frontier  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET directions TO the list of pairs representing movement right one step left one step down one step and up one step  
        SET m TO the LENGTH OF grid  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid  
        SET start TO no value assigned  
        SET num_keys TO zero  
        FOR i FROM zero TO the value m MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the value n MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid at position j EQUALS the character at sign at symbol  
                    SET start TO the pair of values i and j  
                ELSE IF element at position i of grid at position j IS a lowercase letter  
                    INCREMENT num_keys BY one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET queue TO a new double ended queue containing the single element of the tuple of value at position zero of start value at position one of start zero zero  
        SET visited TO a new set containing the single element of the tuple of value at position zero of start value at position one of start zero  
        WHILE queue is not empty  
            SET x y keys steps TO the tuple removed from the front of queue  
            FOR each pair dx dy IN directions  
                SET nx TO x PLUS dx  
                SET ny TO y PLUS dy  
                IF nx IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND nx IS LESS THAN m AND ny IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND ny IS LESS THAN n  
                    SET cell TO element at position nx of grid at position ny  
                    IF cell EQUALS the hash symbol  
                        CONTINUE to next iteration of FOR loop  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS an uppercase letter  
                        SET key_needed TO one SHIFTED LEFT BY the Unicode code point of the lowercase form of cell MINUS the Unicode code point of letter a  
                        IF the result of keys AND key_needed EQUALS zero  
                            CONTINUE to next iteration of FOR loop  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS a lowercase letter  
                        SET new_keys TO the result of keys OR one SHIFTED LEFT BY the Unicode code point of cell MINUS the Unicode code point of letter a  
                        IF new_keys EQUALS one SHIFTED LEFT BY num_keys MINUS one  
                            RETURN steps PLUS one  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET new_keys TO keys  
                    END IF  
                    IF the tuple nx ny new_keys IS NOT in visited  
                        ADD the tuple nx ny new_keys TO visited  
                        APPEND the tuple nx ny new_keys steps PLUS one TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION superEggDrop(k, n)  
        LET tests BE 0  
        LET attempts BE a list initialized with zeros whose size equals k + 1  
        REPEAT  
            tests ← tests + 1  
            LET eggIndex BE k  
            WHILE eggIndex GREATER THAN 0  
                attempts[eggIndex] ← 1 + attempts[eggIndex - 1] + attempts[eggIndex]  
                eggIndex ← eggIndex - 1  
            END WHILE  
        UNTIL attempts[k] GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
        RETURN tests  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION superEggDrop(k, n)  
        SET dp TO a list of zeros with length k PLUS one  
        SET moves TO zero  
        WHILE element at position k of dp LESS THAN n holds  
            INCREMENT moves BY one  
            FOR eggs FROM k DOWN TO one  
                SET element at position eggs of dp TO one PLUS element at position eggs MINUS one of dp PLUS element at position eggs of dp  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN moves  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION distinctSubseqII(s)  
        SET modValue AS 1_000_000_007  
        SET lengthOfString AS LENGTH OF s  
        SET dpArray AS A LIST CONTAINING ZEROS OF SIZE lengthOfString PLUS 1  
        SET dpArray AT 0 AS 1  
        SET seenPositions AS AN EMPTY MAP  
        
        SET indexCounter TO 1  
        WHILE indexCounter IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO lengthOfString  
            SET currentCharacter TO s AT POSITION (indexCounter MINUS 1)  
            
            SET doubledPrevious TO dpArray AT (indexCounter MINUS 1) PLUS dpArray AT (indexCounter MINUS 1)  
            SET dpArray AT indexCounter AS doubledPrevious MODULO modValue  
            
            IF NOT (currentCharacter NOT IN seenPositions) THEN  
                SET pastIndex TO seenPositions AT currentCharacter  
                SET subtractedValue TO dpArray AT (pastIndex MINUS 1)  
                SET updatedValue TO dpArray AT indexCounter MINUS subtractedValue PLUS modValue  
                SET dpArray AT indexCounter AS updatedValue MODULO modValue  
            END IF  
            
            SET seenPositions AT currentCharacter AS indexCounter  
            INCREMENT indexCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET finalResult AS dpArray AT lengthOfString MINUS 1  
        RETURN finalResult MODULO modValue  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION distinctSubseqII(s)  
        SET MOD TO ten POWER nine PLUS seven  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET dp TO a list OF zeroes WITH LENGTH n PLUS one  
        SET the element at position zero of dp TO one  
        SET last TO an empty mapping  
        FOR i FROM one TO n  
            SET char TO the element at position i MINUS one of s  
            SET the element at position i of dp TO the element at position i MINUS one of dp MULTIPLIED BY two  
            SET the element at position i of dp TO the element at position i of dp MODULO MOD  
            IF char EXISTS IN the keys OF last  
                SET the element at position i of dp TO the element at position i of dp MINUS the element at position last at char MINUS one of dp PLUS MOD  
                SET the element at position i of dp TO the element at position i of dp MODULO MOD  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN last at char TO i  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp MINUS one MODULO MOD  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION lastSubstring(s)  
        LET lengthVar BE LENGTH OF s  
        LET highestChar BE MAXIMUM CHARACTER IN s  
        LET positions BE AN EMPTY LIST  
        LET index COUNTER TO 0  
        WHILE index < lengthVar DO  
            IF s[index] = highestChar THEN  
                APPEND index TO positions  
            END IF  
            SET index TO index + 1  
        END WHILE  

        LET candidateSubstring BE ""  
        LET posIndex POINTER TO 0  
        WHILE posIndex < LENGTH OF positions DO  
            LET substringStart BE positions[posIndex]  
            LET tempSubstring BE SLICE OF s FROM substringStart TO (LENGTH OF s)  
            IF NOT (candidateSubstring >= tempSubstring) THEN  
                SET candidateSubstring TO tempSubstring  
            END IF  
            SET posIndex TO posIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN candidateSubstring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION lastSubstring(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET max_char TO the MAXIMUM CHARACTER IN s  
        SET max_indices TO an empty list  
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF the element at position i of s EQUALS max_char  
                APPEND i TO max_indices  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET max_substring TO the empty string  
        FOR each start IN max_indices  
            SET current_substring TO the substring of s from position start TO the END  
            IF current_substring GREATER THAN max_substring  
                SET max_substring TO current_substring  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN max_substring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maximumMinutes(grid)
        SET rowCount AS LENGTH OF grid
        SET colCount AS LENGTH OF element AT 0 OF grid
        SET moves AS LIST OF PAIRS: (1, 0), (-1, 0), (0, 1), (0, -1)

        FUNCTION can_escape(wait)
            SET fireArrival TO a 2D LIST sized rowCount BY colCount FILLED WITH infinity
            CREATE deque AS empty double-ended queue

            SET iCounter TO 0
            WHILE iCounter < rowCount
                SET jCounter TO 0
                WHILE jCounter < colCount
                    IF element AT iCounter OF grid = 1 THEN
                        PUSH (iCounter, jCounter, 0) TO deque
                        ASSIGN fireArrival[iCounter][jCounter] ← 0
                    END IF
                    INCREMENT jCounter BY 1
                END WHILE
                INCREMENT iCounter BY 1
            END WHILE

            WHILE deque IS NOT empty
                POP_LEFT (currX, currY, currTime) FROM deque
                FOR EACH (dx, dy) IN moves DO
                    SET nextX TO currX + dx
                    SET nextY TO currY + dy
                    IF (nextX ≥ 0) AND (nextX < rowCount) AND (nextY ≥ 0) AND (nextY < colCount) AND (grid[nextX][nextY] = 0) AND (fireArrival[nextX][nextY] = infinity) THEN
                        ASSIGN fireArrival[nextX][nextY] ← currTime + 1
                        PUSH (nextX, nextY, currTime + 1) TO deque
                    END IF
                END FOR
            END WHILE

            SET explorerQueue TO new double-ended queue WITH ELEMENT (0, 0, wait)
            SET visitedSet TO SET CONTAINING PAIR (0, 0)

            WHILE explorerQueue IS NOT empty
                POP_LEFT (posX, posY, timePassed) FROM explorerQueue
                FOR EACH (offsetX, offsetY) IN moves DO
                    SET candidateX TO posX + offsetX
                    SET candidateY TO posY + offsetY
                    IF (candidateX ≥ 0) AND (candidateX < rowCount) AND (candidateY ≥ 0) AND (candidateY < colCount) AND NOT ((candidateX, candidateY) IN visitedSet) AND (grid[candidateX][candidateY] = 0) THEN
                        IF (candidateX = rowCount - 1) AND (candidateY = colCount - 1) THEN
                            IF fireArrival[candidateX][candidateY] ≥ timePassed + 1 THEN
                                RETURN true
                            ELSE
                                RETURN false
                            END IF
                        END IF
                        IF fireArrival[candidateX][candidateY] > timePassed + 1 THEN
                            ADD (candidateX, candidateY) TO visitedSet
                            PUSH (candidateX, candidateY, timePassed + 1) TO explorerQueue
                        END IF
                    END IF
                END FOR
            END WHILE

            RETURN false
        END FUNCTION

        SET startPos TO 0
        SET endPos TO rowCount * colCount
        SET answer TO -1

        WHILE startPos ≤ endPos
            SET middle TO startPos + FLOOR((endPos - startPos) / 2)
            IF can_escape(middle) THEN
                ASSIGN answer ← middle
                ASSIGN startPos ← middle + 1
            ELSE
                ASSIGN endPos ← middle - 1
            END IF
        END WHILE

        IF answer ≠ rowCount * colCount THEN
            RETURN answer
        ELSE
            RETURN 1000000000
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maximumMinutes(grid)  
        SET m TO the LENGTH OF grid  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid  
        SET directions TO the LIST of elements each being a PAIR consisting of one and zero MINUS one and zero zero and one zero and MINUS one  
        
        FUNCTION can_escape(wait)  
            SET fire_times TO a two-dimensional list of size m by n each element set TO infinity  
            SET queue TO an empty double-ended queue  
            
            FOR i FROM zero TO m MINUS one  
                FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                    IF element at position i of grid EQUALS one  
                        APPEND the TRIPLE consisting of i j and zero TO queue  
                        SET element at position i and j of fire_times TO zero  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            
            WHILE queue is not empty  
                REMOVE the first element and ASSIGN its components TO x y and t  
                FOR each dx dy IN directions  
                    SET nx TO x PLUS dx  
                    SET ny TO y PLUS dy  
                    IF nx GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND nx LESS THAN m AND ny GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND ny LESS THAN n AND element at position nx and ny of grid EQUALS zero AND element at position nx and ny of fire_times EQUALS infinity  
                        SET element at position nx and ny of fire_times TO t PLUS one  
                        APPEND the TRIPLE consisting of nx ny and t PLUS one TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END WHILE  
            
            SET queue TO a double-ended queue containing a single TRIPLE consisting of zero zero and wait  
            SET visited TO a set containing the PAIR zero zero  
            
            WHILE queue is not empty  
                REMOVE the first element and ASSIGN its components TO x y and t  
                FOR each dx dy IN directions  
                    SET nx TO x PLUS dx  
                    SET ny TO y PLUS dy  
                    IF nx GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND nx LESS THAN m AND ny GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND ny LESS THAN n AND the PAIR nx ny NOT IN visited AND element at position nx and ny of grid EQUALS zero  
                        IF nx EQUALS m MINUS one AND ny EQUALS n MINUS one  
                            IF element at position nx and ny of fire_times GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO t PLUS one  
                                RETURN true  
                            ELSE  
                                RETURN false  
                            END IF  
                        END IF  
                        IF element at position nx and ny of fire_times GREATER THAN t PLUS one  
                            ADD the PAIR nx ny TO visited  
                            APPEND the TRIPLE consisting of nx ny and t PLUS one TO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END WHILE  
            
            RETURN false  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET left TO zero  
        SET right TO m MULTIPLIED BY n  
        SET result TO MINUS one  
        
        WHILE left LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO right  
            SET mid TO left PLUS right DIVIDED BY two rounded down to the nearest integer  
            IF can_escape(mid)  
                SET result TO mid  
                SET left TO mid PLUS one  
            ELSE  
                SET right TO mid MINUS one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        
        IF result NOT EQUALS m MULTIPLIED BY n  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN one followed by nine zeros  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION appealSum(s)
        DECLARE lastIndices AS list WITH size 26 INITIALIZED BY -1 REPEATEDLY
        DECLARE sumOfAppeals AS 0
        DECLARE currentValue AS 0
        DECLARE pos AS 0
        WHILE pos < LENGTH(s)
            DECLARE character AS s[pos]
            DECLARE letterIndex AS (ORD(character) - ORD('a'))
            DECLARE contribution AS (pos - lastIndices[letterIndex])
            currentValue ← currentValue + contribution
            sumOfAppeals ← sumOfAppeals + currentValue
            lastIndices[letterIndex] ← pos
            pos ← pos + 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN sumOfAppeals
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION appealSum(s)  
        SET last TO a list of length twenty six with each element set to minus one  
        SET total_appeal TO zero  
        SET current_appeal TO zero  
        FOR each position i AND character char IN the enumeration of s  
            SET index TO the numeric code of character char MINUS the numeric code of character a  
            INCREMENT current_appeal BY position i MINUS element at position index of last  
            INCREMENT total_appeal BY current_appeal  
            SET element at position index of last TO position i  
        END FOR  
        RETURN total_appeal  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean
        IF LENGTH sentence1 == LENGTH sentence2 THEN
        ELSE
            RETURN false
        END IF

        DECLARE registry AS dictionary = {}

        FUNCTION find(element element TO element) RETURNS element
            DECLARE stack AS list = []
            DECLARE current AS element = element
            WHILE current != registry[current] DO
                PUSH current INTO stack
                SET current = registry[current]
            END WHILE
            FOR each node IN stack DO
                SET registry[node] = current
            END FOR
            RETURN current
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION union(first first TO first second second TO second)
            DECLARE rootFirst AS first = find(first)
            DECLARE rootSecond AS second = find(second)
            IF rootFirst != rootSecond THEN
                SET registry[rootSecond] = rootFirst
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        DECLARE index1 AS int = 0
        WHILE index1 < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE couple AS list = similarPairs[index1]
            DECLARE idxWord AS int = 0
            WHILE idxWord < LENGTH couple DO
                DECLARE token AS string = couple[idxWord]
                IF NOT token IN registry THEN
                    SET registry[token] = token
                END IF
                SET idxWord = idxWord + 1
            END WHILE
            SET index1 = index1 + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE idxPair AS int = 0
        WHILE idxPair < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE a AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][0]
            DECLARE b AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][1]
            CALL union(a b)
            SET idxPair = idxPair + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE pos AS int = 0
        WHILE pos < LENGTH sentence1 DO
            DECLARE firstWord AS string = sentence1[pos]
            DECLARE secondWord AS string = sentence2[pos]
            IF NOT firstWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[firstWord] = firstWord
            END IF
            IF NOT secondWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[secondWord] = secondWord
            END IF

            IF find(firstWord) != find(secondWord) THEN
                RETURN false
            END IF
            SET pos = pos + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN true
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean  
        IF the LENGTH OF sentence1 NOT EQUALS the LENGTH OF sentence2  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        SET parent TO empty dictionary  

        FUNCTION find(x x TO x) RETURNS x  
            IF element at position x of parent NOT EQUALS x  
                SET element at position x of parent TO find(element at position x of parent)  
            END IF  
            RETURN element at position x of parent  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION union(x x TO x y y TO y)  
            SET rootX TO find(x)  
            SET rootY TO find(y)  
            IF rootX NOT EQUALS rootY  
                SET element at position rootY of parent TO rootX  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR each pair IN similarPairs  
            FOR each word IN pair  
                IF word NOT IN parent  
                    SET element at position word of parent TO word  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        FOR each x y IN similarPairs  
            union(x y)  
        END FOR  

        FOR each w1 w2 IN sentence1 sentence2  
            IF w1 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w1 of parent TO w1  
            END IF  
            IF w2 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w2 of parent TO w2  
            END IF  
            IF find(w1) NOT EQUALS find(w2)  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)
            IF age_y <= (age_x / 2 + 7) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF age_y > age_x THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF (age_y > 100) AND (age_x < 100) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE
                RETURN true
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        SET tally TO dictionary()
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(ages)
            IF ages[idx] IN tally THEN
                tally[ages[idx]] = tally[ages[idx]] + 1
            ELSE
                tally[ages[idx]] = 1
            END IF
            idx = idx + 1
        END WHILE

        SET accumulated TO 0
        SET p_age_x TO 1
        WHILE p_age_x <= 120
            SET p_age_y TO 1
            WHILE p_age_y <= 120
                IF request_will_be_sent(p_age_x, p_age_y) THEN
                    IF p_age_x = p_age_y THEN
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * (tally.get(p_age_y, 0) - 1))
                    ELSE
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * tally.get(p_age_y, 0))
                    END IF
                END IF
                p_age_y = p_age_y + 1
            END WHILE
            p_age_x = p_age_x + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulated
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)  
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
            RETURN NOT (age_y IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO age_x MULTIPLIED BY one half PLUS seven OR age_y IS GREATER THAN age_x OR age_y IS GREATER THAN one hundred AND age_x IS LESS THAN one hundred)  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET count TO list of zero repeated one hundred and twenty one times  
        FOR each age IN ages  
            INCREMENT element at position age of count BY one  
        END FOR  

        SET total_requests TO zero  
        FOR age_x FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
            FOR age_y FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
                IF request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
                    INCREMENT total_requests BY element at position age_x of count MULTIPLIED BY element at position age_y of count MINUS one IF age_x EQUALS age_y ELSE element at position age_y of count  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN total_requests  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
